timeline.bodyText: I don't think (indirectly) is suitable here, it should just be Checks if a block is indirectly or directly powered by redstone
timeline.author: Wealthyturtle

timeline.bodyText: If you put brackets () in register(), it means that that's a mandatory field, i.e. redstone powered will no longer be a valid condition with your change. I think you meant to use square brackets [] instead? Those indicate that it's an optional phrase.
timeline.author: Wealthyturtle

replies.bodyText:
The way they did it is valid, since the options would be "" and "indirectly"
Maybe redstone should be optional though
replies.author: APickledWalrus

replies.bodyText: Really? Didn't know that about parse marks... haha
replies.author: Wealthyturtle

replies.bodyText:
Thank you for your reviews!
Concerning making redstone optional, I was advised to use redstone power to avoid conflicts (#3091 (comment)).
replies.author: Romitou

timeline.bodyText:
Also, you don't need parse marks for these, you can register 2 separate condition patterns, like
Skript.registerCondition(CondCanHold.class,
				"%inventories% (can hold|ha(s|ve) [enough] space (for|to hold)) %itemtypes%",
				"%inventories% (can(no|')t hold|(ha(s|ve) not|ha(s|ve)n't|do[es]n't have) [enough] space (for|to hold)) %itemtypes%");

But you would need to change the class declaration to public class CondIsBlockRedstonePowered extends Condition... although other developers might prefer parse marks, I think that's up for discussion.
timeline.author: Wealthyturtle

replies.bodyText:
They could get rid of the 0 parse mark, making it just
(|1¦indirectly)
replies.author: APickledWalrus

replies.bodyText: or just do two patterns to reduce the needless complexity
replies.author: Pikachu920

replies.bodyText: I'm going to use two patterns; thanks for your reviews.
replies.author: Romitou

timeline.message: CondIsBlockRedstonePowered - Changes due to code reviews

timeline.author: FranKusmiruk

timeline.message:
CondIsBlockRedstonePowered- Addition of suggested changes

Co-authored-by: Frank Kusmiruk <48283695+FranKusmiruk@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: There is no need to use a Boolean object, a primitive will do
timeline.author: Wealthyturtle

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to return PropertyCondition.toString, just "redstone" + (isIndirectlyPowered ? "indirectly " : "") + "powered" should do
timeline.author: Wealthyturtle

replies.bodyText: this actually isn't true the way he had it before was correct
replies.author: Pikachu920

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we could have [directly] redstone powered as patterns as well?
timeline.author: Wealthyturtle

replies.bodyText: You're right; I will add it.
replies.author: Romitou
